SENT.plain: Acute otitis media complications are relative rare since the introduction of antibiotics
Still many controversies exist on the diagnosis and treatment of some of them

In this report we describe a pediatric case of upper cervical abscess (bezold abscess), sigmoid sinus thrombosis and occipital osteomyelitis following mastoiditis, presenting with persistent fever and otorrhea
The patient responded well to intravenous antibiotics and wall-intact mastoidectomy
We discuss methods of early diagnosis and appropriate treatment options
